comments:
Build 20020515

While shutting down my workspace, I got the following exception. It seems that 
the debug plugin is trying to restart...

        at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.DelegatingURLClassLoader.loadClass

        at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.DelegatingURLClassLoader.loadClass

        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:315)
        at 
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.views.console.ConsoleDocument.handleDebugEvents

        at org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugPlugin.fireDebugEventSet
(DebugPlugin.java:200)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.RuntimeProcess.fireEvent
(RuntimeProcess.java:222)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.RuntimeProcess.fireTerminateEvent
(RuntimeProcess.java:230)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.RuntimeProcess.terminated
(RuntimeProcess.java:199)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.ProcessMonitor.monitorProcess
(ProcessMonitor.java:49)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.ProcessMonitor.access$0

        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.ProcessMonitor$1.run
(ProcessMonitor.java:62)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:484)

Fixed.

The problem was that we were calling FooManager.getDefault() when the 
singleton instance of FooManager had not been created yet. Added protection 
against this case to DebugUIPlugin.shutdown() and applicable managers.

traces.message: Problems encountered starting up plug- in: org.eclipse.debug.ui.
